item.title: Alaska Native Claims Settlement Improvement Act of 2017

latestAction.text: Committee on Energy and Natural Resources Subcommittee on Public Lands, Forests, and Mining. Hearings held. With printed Hearing: S.Hrg. 115-502.

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

summary.text:
ANCSA Cook Inlet Region Land Conveyance Finalization Act of 2017

This bill requires the Department of the Interior to convey to Cook Inlet Region, Inc. (CIRI), an Alaska Native regional corporation, land CIRI selects from specified areas to satisfy its claim to an additional 43,000 acres under the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act. CIRI is granted a right of notice and first refusal for federal land or property identified as excess in CIRI's region.

bill.title: ANCSA Cook Inlet Region Land Conveyance Finalization Act of 2017

item.title: ANCSA Cook Inlet Region Land Conveyance Finalization Act of 2017
A bill to satisfy certain claims under the Alaska Native Claims Settlement Act, and for other purposes.
ANCSA Cook Inlet Region Land Conveyance Finalization Act of 2017

latestAction.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Energy and Natural Resources.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
